cab.content: (this ix)cnment 'is the prop^.'y..u? his, britamxc.majesty*s governmentS ICR ST.--- WAR CABINET.G.T. 334-8.MATERNITY AND CHILD WELFARE BILL. Note by Sir Edwin Cornwall. .I have the Memorandum from the War Cabinet which Mr. Hayes Fisher, President of oho Local Government Board, sent to them on January 12th with reference to his proposed Maternity and Infant Welfare Bill * G,I\ isi?) *On October $ls'z last I 3-.iomtt3d a Memorandum (g.t.2460) to the War Cabinet on this proposal, and set out certain amendments which should be embodied in the Bill before being introduced.I V-''"'-'''' ' ' - ' . .', , .'v.;., ; . ',\ ;- ' - -r\ -v. - .. - i , - ' ' - ; ' ' ...... .I have nothing to add now to that Memorandum beyond drawing the Cabinet!s notice to what I then indicated, andstating that it has been impressed upon me from several quarters that the objections felt to the proposal in its present shape have in no way diminished, but have rather become inte tsified by the further consideration given to the matter.(Signed) EDWIN CORNWALL.240Buckingham Gate, London, S.W.l th January, 1918..
